reference: 1. Bhattarai K. and J. Whalley (1998). The Division and Size of Gains from Liber- alization of Service Networks. NBER Working Paper No. w6712.

4. Krugman, P. and M. Obstfeld (2000). International Economics: Theory and Policy. Fifth Edition, Addison-Wesley-Longman.
6. Townsend, Robert M. (1995). Consumption Insurance: An evaluation of Risk- Bearing Systems in Low Income Economies. The Journal of Economic Perspec- tives, Vol. 9 No. 2 pp: 83-102.
7. Winters, P., A. de Janvry, and E. Sadoulet (2001). Family and Community Networks in Mexico-U.S. Migration. Journal of Human Rsources, Vol. 36, pp: 159-184.
8. Zahnister, S. S. (1999). Mexican Migration to the United States: the Role of Migration Networks and Human Capital Accumulation. New York and London: Garland Publishing (Taylor and Francis Group).
